info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 01 at 3:40AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG EARLY THIS MORNING... Areas of fog will continue to develop across portions of Beaufort, Jasper and Chatham Counties through sunrise. The fog could become locally dense at time with visibilities dropping to 1/4 mile or less. The nature of the fog is such that visibilities will vary greatly over short distances with the risk for locally dense fog being the greatest near bodies of water and other low-lying areas such as marshes, swamps and large ditches. Motorists should remain alert for these conditions this morning. Some locations that could see locally dense fog include Lobeco, Beaufort, Bluffton, Parris Island, Hilton Head, Wilmington Island and the east side of the Savannah Metro Area.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down and leave extra distance ahead of you in case a sudden stop is needed.
